<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma1
</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Multiplayer
</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Event Handlers

</value></part><part><name>serverExec</name>=<value> server

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> This command will execute attached code whenever a player is leaving an MP session. The code will receive a number of special variables:

* '''_id''': [[Number]] - is the unique DirectPlay ID. Quite useless as the number is too big for in-built string representation and gets rounded. It is also the same id used for user placed markers.
* '''_uid''': [[String]] - is [[getPlayerUID]] of the leaving player. In Arma 3 it is also the same as Steam ID.
* '''_name''': [[String]] - is [[profileName]] of the leaving player.
* '''_jip''': (''since Arma 3 v1.49'') [[Boolean]] - is a flag that indicated whether or not the player joined after the mission has started ('''J'''oined '''I'''n '''P'''rogress). [[true]] - if the player was JIP, otherwise [[false]].
* '''_owner''': (''since Arma 3 v1.49'') [[Number]] - is [[owner]] id of the leaving player. Can be used for kick or ban purposes or just for [[publicVariableClient]].
* '''_idstr''': (''since Arma 3 v1.95'') [[String]] - same as <tt>_id</tt> but in string format, so could be exactly compared to [[allMapMarkers | user marker]] ids.<br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Informative</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Since '''Arma 3''' ''v1.57'' a stackable version of this EH is available: [[Arma_3:_Event_Handlers/addMissionEventHandler#PlayerDisconnected|PlayerDisconnected]]</value></part></template><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>In order to keep compatibility between official and community content the functions [[BIS_fnc_addStackedEventHandler]] and [[BIS_fnc_removeStackedEventHandler]] should be used instead.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''onPlayerDisconnected''' code

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value>  code: [[String]] or [[Code]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[onPlayerDisconnected]] "[[diag_log]] [_id, _uid, _name]";</code>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[onPlayerDisconnected]] {
	[[if]] ([[count]] [[allPlayers]] == 0) [[then]] {
		[[endMission]] "END1";
	};
};</code>

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[onPlayerConnected]], [[didJIP]], [[didJIPOwner]], [[Arma_3:_Event_Handlers/addMissionEventHandler#HandleDisconnect|HandleDisconnect]]

</value></part><part><name>mp</name>=<value> In MP [[onPlayerDisconnected]] is executed only on the server
</value></part></template>
